Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Nessymoomoo
Reviews.Content: We stay here 3 nights for my birthday. The first night we were on the 3rd floor. The room was very small but nice and clean but we asked to be moved because there was no lift. Breakfast is an experience! It was basic but actually lovely. The fresh ham was stunning. The second night we were put on the second floor down a wing. The rooms were much much bigger and the bathroom nicer. The hallway outside out room was so pretty. Fantastic base for being close to most things. They don't have tea facilities in room. We purchased a small travel kettle which was a life saver:) no bar as such but you've got loads nearby. Found Venice very beautiful - the grand canal but on a gondola ride smaller canals show done of the worst of Venice and a but smelly to be honest. You gave to do it to say youve done it though. Getting to the hotel from airport wasn't too bad. We went to the customer services desk and purchased a return ticket on the public ferry which took us to the pier at Rialto bridge and hotel about 10 min walk. If u find the opera fenice, turn right passed the church then first left - dead easy when you finally find it. I was worried because of the negative feedback, but dont regret staying there :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (not like the reviews!)”
Reviews.Author: omh1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 10-14 April with my partner and 2 kids. Our room was small but they all are in Venice. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels left for us. The girl on the recception was polite and friendly. The breakfast was ok, I found something to eat, fruit, bread rolls, croissants etc. Would stay here again no problems. Not too hard to find, to the right of the theatre (when looking at it face on), and there is a wee sign above the alley saying Ateneo. Venice is a maze and very easy to get lost in, so have a good map at all times!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find - look for the opera!”
Reviews.Author: LeTourer
Reviews.Content: After stepping off the water "bus" at the docks at San Marco Square, we struggled to find our way to the Hotel. We thought we knew how to find it (we had a map) but were lost and wandering for almost an hour with heavy suitcases in stifling heat going up and down bridges and a maze of laneways. You really do need to ask someone for directions to the "Teatro La Fenice." (La Fenice Opera) This is one of two opera houses in Venice and the Hotel Ateneo is right nearby. Many locals can't tell you where the hotel is but they all seem to know where the Teatro La Fenice is. You CAN get a water "taxi" from the airport which is much more expensive but will take you practically to the door. There's no elevator so not ideal for elderly guests or for carting luggage up and down stairways. You have to lug your own suitcases. Our room was a family room for four which consisted of a double bed, a single, and a sofa bed that would be a couch if there were only three guests in the room. Not much room left for luggage. The bathroom door didn't shut completely. (We'd read a review before we booked and we obviously got that same room) Quite funny. It wasn't really a major drama for us. We had a view right over a canal which was sensational. We'd read reviews to say the rooms were not much more than cupboards and we did indeed see an example down one of the hallways - it really was just a single bed in there and nothing else, a window with no view at all, and no space for a person to stand, let alone a place for a suitcase. At least we did have room to move in ours. A buffet breakfast was included in our price which was quite okay but nothing brilliant and not a wide variety of choice - mainly cereals and breads. It is a very small and tight dining room which only caters to a few guests at a time. The girl on the front desk was lovely, helpful and friendly. The cleaning staff/dining staff (same people) didn't go out of their way to be nice to most guests but when they found out we were from Australia, you couldn't find lovelier ladies. The Hotel is really close to lots of restaurants and once you know where you are, it's an ideal location for wandering around, shopping, eating out and discovering what Venice has on offer. I'd stay there again, but only if I had that same room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel we booked and the first room was a cupboard but after that OK”
Reviews.Author: spatchlet
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at San Moise but on arrival were taken to this hotel with no explanation. We were even told it was the same hotel! The first night was dreadful. The room was so small and the tiny window looked onto a wall. The bathroom was tiny and the shower didn't work. We asked to be moved but they said it would have to be the next day. Our second room was great - light and airy with room to move and a good bathroom. Breakfast was fine and the staff helpful. Location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “just the position, but stay away”
Reviews.Author: chemistgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room at Hotel San MoisÃ¨, where I had already stayed three times before. I knew that they can put in one of their "depandances", this had happened to me twice, but everything was good in Ca' Fortuny and in Ca' Alvise. This third time was AWFUL. We were three, they gave a single room with three beds, 3rd floor, no elevator. The bathroom was not so bad, even if the bathtub was leaking a little, and the ceiling was really low. The TV in the room was malfunctioning, because it was badly connected. The air conditioning, instead, worked, and maybe was the only one good thing in the room. Breakfast was really bad, the room was tiny and really overcrowded, the food was dull. I have to add that the price was really good, but it's not a good reason to give such bad service, since we booked this room with months af advance!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dg5471
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the hotel over all. Very small rooms, even by european standards, no elevator and we were on the 3rd floor, which meant hauling our luggage up all those flights of stairs. Nice to have a breakfast included but it was very minimal. After checking out of the hotel I discovered that I probably had left something at their hotel. I emailed and called them just to check and was treated very rudely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price x Benefits”
Reviews.Author: hiltonhilton
Reviews.Content: Ateneo at Venice is a olb style building, very confortable rooms (clean, large, nice athroom). My room was located inthe back of the building, with a canal view, where we could listen the fabulous singers and music players in the "gondolas". WOW! Breakfast included is "basic" and not good service. Very good reception. Big issue: how to find the hotel after as long trip, arriving by night? Ask previously for a good map and hotel location! Venice is just: FANTASTIC!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: violet023
Reviews.Content: Good location behind San Marco Square. Front desk polite and helpful. Triple room very tiny and had to ask for soap and tissues but did get them both. Breakfast could be better. Venice very crowded in summer. Still love this city!! Please don't visit Claudia's shop around the hotel area. She rudely told us to leave her shop as we were not going to buy there and we were wasting her time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: JHMIII
Reviews.Content: We slept two couples in our room and it was pretty tight. Would have been more appropriate for 2 but we were on a budget and really didnt mind squeezing in. The Hotel was clean, air conditioner worked well, and breakfast was good. The hotel also provided free wifi and had nice quiet court yard with some tables perfect for a late afternoon bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: emattox
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother in-law and his wife stayed at Hotel Ateneo for 2 nights. The service was good. The rooms are small but are comparable to what you would expect for a European hotel. We had air conditioning which was a ++ in the hot summer months. The location was great but Venice is so small that really anywhere would have been okay. The breakfast in the morning was good and typical of a European morning meal with deli meat, cheese, bread, pastries, cereal, fruit, juice, and coffee. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend! (We paid extra for private taxi from the airport....so worth it as they took us to the door of the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off. Tourist scam. Stay away”
Reviews.Author: 60763Tourist
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Ateneo in Venice along with the flights and other hotels and Expedia confirmed the reservation. When we got to Ateneo we were told that there are no rooms at the hotel but they have another building 10 minutes away. Ten minutes turned out to be 30 minutes and another building turned out to be another hotel Belle Arti which is located on different island. The reason we booked that hotel is because it is located right in the center of the city close to all attractions and everything else. Now we have to stay 30 minutes away from everything on another end of the town. We called ateneo and demanded to go back to Ateneo or another hotel near by . They said there was nothing available but tomorrow they will try to find something for us. Next morning we left the room and went for a walk, when we came back to Belle arti we were told that that our room is no longer available and it was given to somebody else. All of our stuff was thrown in the bags and moved to another hotel on another end of town.we never gave anyone any permission to come to our room and touch our personal stuff some of which was missing and most of which was damaged and the hotel staff felt like there was nothing wrong with that. we did not want to move again and waist another two hours of our vacation so we requested another room at that belle arti hotel but of course there were no more rooms available. there was one room at another hotel across the street named Domus Cavanis which they said is the same category hotel, but if you look at their website it said that its 1 star hotel. Fine, we just wanted it to be over. Next day i spoke to the owner but he felt no remorse and tried to blame it on another hotel. I file claim for missing items and of course i never heard from him again.The staff and management at ateneo and belle arti is absolutely the same ignorant inconsiderate unapologetic scum artists We went home next day just to find out that expedia encourages that kind of practices and doesn't mind when its customers get ripped off while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “NOT what I expected AT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: Alina518
Reviews.Content: Way to small!!!! You can take a shower, go to the bathroom and wash your teeth at the same time. WOW. There is no even space to put your luggage. Go at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: ScalzotourItaly
Reviews.Content: The Ateneo Hotel was wonderful, hidden in the streets of Venice. It met all our expectations, old world charm and modern facilities. The room was the most spacious of the hotels we stayed in while in Italy. The young woman at the front desk was so helpful when we were looking for restaurants and pointed us in the right direction when we were choosing things to do. We loved the trip to Murano glass.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER - DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leesh_UK
Reviews.Content: WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN!!!!!!! We booked a night in Hotel Marconi but got told on arrival that 'theres a problem' and got made to walk across town with our luggage to a chain hotel - Hotel Ateneo. No explanation was given as to what the 'problem' was - despite us questioning several times about why we were being moved to a different hotel! We were told over and over again by two women at reception (one with long curly brown hair, one with short blond hair) that there was NO ISSUE and that the hotel is in fact the SAME as what we booked, However, just because they are in the same CHAIN of hotels, it does not mean that they are in fact are the SAME hotel!!!!. The reception staff did not understand this concept - if we wantd to stay at Hotel Ateneo, we wouldve booked at Hotel Ateneo, not Hotel Marconi. The staff are just rude and ignorant - is it that hard to be honest and just say there was an over-booking??? I would not except such terrible service from a hotel I've paid hundreds to stay in! They also refused to give us a refund when we asked for one - we would've preferred to get our money back and pay double to stay elsewhere. In terms of location - you can certainly find ALOT better in Venice!! For the price we paid, I would except to be staying in a hotel at the waterfront (which is actually why we booked Hotel Marconi in the first place). Instead, we got taken through town and down a back alley to this hotel. In terms of the room itself - our room was so small, our double bed was the only thing that fit in it! Not even enough space to open up a suitcase on the floor! The bathroom door also couldnt fully open as the end of the bed was in the way! I'm truely stunned as to why anyone would pay money to stay in a place like this!! My advice - If you want to enjoy your time in Venice, DO NOT stay in Hotel Ateneo!! It's worth paying a bit more to stay at a hotel with class!

Reviews.Title: “Part of Tourist Scam! Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: etcetera1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of the tourist scam from Hotel Marconi (see reviews on tripadvisor on this hotel in venice). I booked a room at Hotel Marconi and upon arriving was told that there was a 'problem' with the room. When I asked them to explain, they didn't not reveal what the problem was and was very rude. They placed me in this hotel which was a good 10-15 minutes away from Hotel Marconi. Upon arrival at this hotel, I again enquired why I was moved to this hotel. They receptionist was very rude and refused to answer the question. Her response was "it is all the same hotel", "you are at the same place" - well i certainly don't consider a change in location the same place. Asking for a refund was out of the question and judging from the hotel reviews from hotel marconi, this is quite a common tourist scam. The hotel rooms at Atheno (the one night that I stayed there) was: 1. Dirty - I broke up in hives..and i've travelled across asia before 2. Things were broken in the room and in order for me to even be able to sleep at this place, I had to make sure I was drunk. Considering that I paid over 100 quid for this room, it was DEFINITELY not value for money ..and totally destroyed my experience of Venice. AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: hobbit17
Reviews.Content: Good value for money , yes the rooms are small but how much time do you spend in a room, that is not what I go to Venice for. Staff were very helpfull everytime we had a question they went out of the way to answer it. Found the location to be ideal central to everything City is not as big as it looks on a map all the streets are very short. Only minus is leave the window open and you will get misquitois all of us got bitten, took us a while to figure out what was happening. Breakfast was more than adequate and you could eat as much as you want. Location? stand in front of theatre walk left and forward past a strange sculpture low down on the right , keep going see a narrow alley way in front of you look up, hanging above it is a sign ATENEO with two arrows pointing up a narrow alley going left walk up there, you will come to a pink wall on your right with a double door opening near the end of the alley, that is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic staff, ideal base for Venice trip.”
Reviews.Author: jennasdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in ateneo and could not fault it. A little hard to find.at first, but just head to fenice theater and you are 20 seconds away. We had a family room on first floor which was very big and comfortable. Big bathroom as well. staff could not be nicer or more helpful. Excellent English from them all. They booked a gondola ride, offered advice and were always on hand with directions. Great location, just 5 mins walk to san Marco. All in all a fine authentic Venetian hotel in a beautiful quiet location. The only possible fault is they don't provide a kettle in bed room. Not a major problem as staff happy to bring you hot drinks to your room, but would still be nice to make your own when you wanted. And breakfast each morning is great. Good selection and plenty of it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical European style. Very comfortable and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: MMSIBOB
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to locate when we first arrived at the vapporetto stop at San Marco. After that it was much easier to locate whenever we went out. The courtyard is off the walk and you need to pay attention. The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. They helped us locate places and arranged our gondola ride which was discounted when booked through the hotel. They arranged the private water taxi as well. Breakfast could have been better but still was not bad. Rolls, cheese, fruit and cold cereal. Rooms were very clean but small. There were four of us and we clearly had no room to keep our luggage anywhere else but under the beds. Decor was pure Venetian which was lovely. No elevators but we were on the second floor which to us Americans would be the third floor. Location was close to San Marco but when navigating the small streets and walkways it was very easy to get places.

Reviews.Title: “Could not swing a cat in the room!”
Reviews.Author: marilynblair
Reviews.Content: Although the room was adequate it was very small.....could not open 2 suitcases at once. The breakfast was ok. Staff was friendly. The rest of Italy we stayed at NH hotels..........now they were excellent & prices were good too!!!

Reviews.Title: “17th Century Palazzo, Venetian splendor”
Reviews.Author: Justine59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ateneo three nights. We paid a bundle for a canal-side room, and it was worth every penny. The floors were yellow marble, the walls were covered in faux-Fortuny fabric, the chandelier was Murano glass - it was spectacular. Our room had a mini bar in the wardrobe and a tv that received four stations, all in Italian. There is no internet access except in the lobby, and they charge extra for internet. I paid 5 Euro for 10 minutes of internet access to verify my plane reservations, a bit ridiculous when you are paying over $330 a night for a room. The night desk clerk speaks little to no English, so try to get your business with the hotel done during the daytime. La Fenice, the fabled opera house, is a stone's throw from the hotel. It is the most beautiful theater you will ever see. Do not miss a tour of this elegant structure, even if you hate opera. They also serve a great lunch! Speaking of food, the Ateneo provides a really nice Continental breakfast in their pretty breakfast room on the main floor. Staying canalside was an experience I'll never reqret, even though the city starts work around 4:30, with the garbage scow, then the bottled water boat, then the workmen who are fighting the glorious decay of this glorious city. Every evening you get serenaded by the gondoliers in your room, so who cares if the towels are frayed?

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at hotel and it wont be the last!!!”
Reviews.Author: venice0810
Reviews.Content: 1st stayed at hotel for our honeymoon and came back for our 2nd anniversary this year. it is a great hotel and very romantic with the gondala going past the bedroom window. the staff are very helpful. still get lost every time we leave the hotel but venice wouldnt be venice if you didnt get lost

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: karol85
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and there was no problems with the reservation what so ever. The lady at the desk spoke very good english and the check in was quick and efficient. We stayed in room 209 a luxury room with a view of the canal. We were told that the house opposite our room once housed Mozart. The room wasnt too big but nice and cozy for our 3 night stay. Bathroom was really nice having all the necessary things needed for a pleasurable stay. Rooms serviced daily of high quality. Nice touch with the marble floors all around the hotel including the room. There is a small desk a wardrobe with a mini bar in it, though no prices any where to be found. Air conditioning works really well for them hot summer days / nights. They do offer laundry services if you require. Breakfast was included in the price of the room, Just a typical continental breakfast, good way to start the day. Only down side is not having a lift, staff do offer to help with bags. Location is roughly 7 mins walk to san marco main square and roughly 7 mins walk to the dock to catch a shuttle back to the station. We looked on all different websites for best prices and nothing could beat the hotels website. Non smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons- But Cons win”
Reviews.Author: vinson7
Reviews.Content: Pros- Great location once you're able to find the hotel Breakfast was included, wasnt the best, but it was included A little courtyard out front where you can sit and have a bottle of wine or coffee Staff was pleasant, the girls at the front desk were nice Cons- No elevator so lugging your bags up 3 flights of stairs really stunk Hotel is hard to find. You seriously have to ask 2 or 3 shop keepers where it is Room was the smallest I have ever stayed in, felt like I was sleeping in a dollhouse. The bed seriously takes up 98% of the room, We had to push the bed against the wall just to allow enough space for our suitcase to sit on the floor. No English channels on the 19inch TV They made you leave your key at the front desk when you left for "security" reasons..thought that was weird. Smallest bathroom in the history of bathrooms..there seriously is about 6 inches between the toilet and the wall, very uncomfortable. All in all, the cons for me outweigh the pros. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awed by first experience of venice and hotel was a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: nicklemaus
Reviews.Content: We booked a short trip last year and went as 2 couples. This was our first experience of Venutian hotels, so used Trip advisor to check out the reputation first! It was NOT difficult to find at all. google the place - look at a map before you go. It was 5 mins to St Marco (There are 2 ways of navigating back to the square without difficulty), even wading through 2' water! We were greeted at the hotel by a quad-lingual receptionist, who as arranged would care for our baggage until booking in time. She provided us with a vital map and bought us each a complimentary drink. The rooms were spectacular - material panel decked the walls and the glass candelabra was typically very big and colourful. Whislt the size of the baththrooms have been criticised by the Yanks reviewing this (and most venutian bathrooms), we found it most adequate.We were there on a VERY wet weekend - St Marco flooded and it wasnt even high tide!. The free trip via launch was worthwhile, with no pressure to buy the Murano glass (but it really is spectacular)... Hotel Breakfast was typically continental, but most adequate by all accounts (Coffee great!!) Staff very competent - I speak absolutely no Italian, but was understood by all of the front of house staff.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money, excelent location,historian decorated,frendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: lumidan
Reviews.Content: As my first trip in Venice the Hotel Ateneo has an ideal location in the San marco area. Incredible large room,butifull decorated â€“historian style.Quite location,very harmfull,frendly stuff.BRAVO !

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: arkodixy
Reviews.Content: I have been ther, and I was very surprised about the hotel. It is a wonderful hotel, luxury and moor than elegant I can say. It is from the 10 not.It is the best all from them, the staff , the room , clearning all.THE bEST HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: maggit
Reviews.Content: Had booked for San Moise hotel and when arrived we were taken to Hotel ateneo but this is quite standard practice in Venice so not too upset as never stayed in either before. Location very central as very close to teatro la fenice based in a quiet courtyard. No elevator so could be a problem for some. Room compact but adequate and very warm for time of year as was snowing and very cold. Staff all very pleasant and breakfast was excellent. Enjoyed my stay and would consider using this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bkbkbk
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on wotif.com after getting the major heebie jeebies from a camping ground in Mestre. My travelling companion and I paid 90 euro for a double room. Given that we were backpacking for six weeks, when we finally arrived at the hotel at around midnight (we got a little lost but the very helpful and rather attractive police helped us with directions) we were delighted to find that the hotel was clean, warm and secure, housed in a charming old building down a calle near La Fenice. No issues with the booking or the service even though we probably weren't the hotel's usual clientele with our dirty backpacks, greasy hair and general air of grottiness, given that the room we stayed in was usually priced at something like 800 euro a night (no joke!!!). The location is absolutely unbeatable, five minutes' walk off St Mark's Square so you can go out and enjoy all that the San Marco area has to offer and hop on a water bus to the other islands. People who don't like stairs or find it hard to climb stairs may not want to stay here as there is no lift but we were used to hauling around our 25kg backpacks everywhere so a couple of flights was nothing for us. The room itself was on the small side but we had no trouble moving around. Bathroom was great, excellent water pressure, hot water that never ran out, bidet (if you like that sort of thing), and a BATH - heaven. There was a wardrobe, tv, room service, minibar, dry cleaning/laundry etc. but all we really used was the bottled water from the minibar. A massive buffet breakfast was provided by the hotel and included in the charge of the room and kept us full until the afternoon. Rooms were cleaned every day. All in all I had a great time at this cozy little hotel and would recommend it - if you can get it at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever...but great location”
Reviews.Author: CoconutMatilda
Reviews.Content: Our room at Hotel Ateneo was smaller than many closets. It literally could not have been any smaller and still fit 2 people. One of us had to sit on the bed so that the other could navigate around the room. The front desk staff was lukewarm. One in particular though, a twenty something blonde, was very helpful. Breakfast was good and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Small, But Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugged2008
Reviews.Content: My first trip into Venice and we caught a water taxi from the airport late at night and arrived at the "back door" - we had to jump off the water taxi onto the landing to get to reception (the receptionist came to help us off the taxi). The room was small (as are all Venice rooms) and not sure how they squeezed in the double bed to the room, with an ensuite bathroom (also small), but all very clean and comfortable. The staff were very, very helpful and went out of their way to recommend decent restaurants that didn't rip of tourists. Breakfasts were nice in the dining room - plenty of food and coffee. Perfect position to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel we booked, but really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: rene_555
Reviews.Content: Originally booked Hotel San Moise and they sent us here instead. Be aware that this hotel is part of a chain and they do frequently send guests to different hotels to the one booked originally...read my review for Hotel San Moise for more info on this! Now down to the hotel. The room we were provided, as you can see from the pictures was gorgeous. We booked a standard room, but I get the feeling to keep us happy (read other review) they upgraded us to a more deluxe room...either way. Lovely. And spacious. Lovely furnshings. Hotel is in a good location. A bit hard to find, so i would phone ahead for exact directions, but this is normally the case with any venice hotel in the maze of alleys and side streets! Nice couple of resturants on your door step. Okay prices. One is more expensive than the other, but serves the best spinach and ricotta ravioli I have ever tasted! About 8 minutes or so walk to the main square of San Marco. Freidnly and helpful staff. Happy to keep your luggage after check out. They even tried to provide us with an adaptor when we asked where we could buy one. (Unfortuntely they didn't have one which converted from Aussie to Italian) Tip for female travellers. They provide a hair drier, but if you have hair which is thick or longer than shoulder length bring your own. It is very small and not very powerful or hot. It took me about 35 minutes to dry my hair when it normally takes 10... I know it seems like niggles to the males reading this, but ladies will understand! Breakfast is good and plentiful. Your usual continental. Crossiants, fruits, cheeses, hams etc: Nice. Stock up before your trip out to venice to save on funding! TIPS FOR VENICE: There are people who will try to sell you "geniunine" gucci bags on the street. It is tempting to buy yourself a real looking knock off, but if the authorities catch you buying one (there are also people undercover doing this) you will be fined 10,000EUROS. The gondola rides are VERY expensive. 80 EUROS for half hour, 100 EUROS for 45 minutes. The boats hold 6, so its best to go in as a group rather than as a couple. There are many city tours in venice, some include gondola rides at good prices. The hotel has loads of leaflets in reception to help you out with these type of activites. There are guys in and around the square who will try to sell you roses. Ladies if they hold it out to you, no matter how forcefully they push it in your hand, do not take it. Once you have hold of it they will not take it back and they will hassle you or your partner for payment for it. WILL ADD PHOTOS IN THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a good one”
Reviews.Author: dragon53
Reviews.Content: I travel to Venice a lot and I stay in different hotels according to the best rates I can get . I think this is a nice hotel . Location is very very good. And yes rooms are small but so are rooms all over Venice . I paid I think about 90 euro for a double which was not bad at all. Thanks, yes stay here you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “murano trip or a plan to make spend money in mazzuccato”
Reviews.Author: bixioUk
Reviews.Content: I have been suggest a trip to murano from the hotel Ateneo and we discover that was a patetic trick planned in advanced with the factory in murano, made only to spend money inside the Mazzuccato.After showed my disappoint to the hotel they only be able to give me stupid excuses spreading faults to every body.Ateneo and Mazzuccato are both a sad example of turist structures existing only to still money to turists

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous restored mansion!”
Reviews.Author: TM01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just stunning! We stayed there for a couple of nights and loved it! It was a short walk to Piazza San Marco. Our bedroom window overlooked the canals. The setting is very old world italian. The rooms were a generous size. The only problem we found was that there was no lift and given our suitcases were huge and heavy we had to give our muscles a work out! Also as this is not a traditional hotel with a traditional reception area we actually woke the hotel owner when we arrived back late from a night out at the local bar. I highly recommend staying here. We stayed in the middle of winter so the prices were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Massimo is the nastiest man in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dezign4u
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I had to wait six months to write this review so I could write it calmly. I wanted to do a lot of thinking and not write bad things out of emotion. So now I'm calm. And I still feel the same. Neither my friend nor I have EVER been treated so poorly by any hotel. We booked a room online. I don't know what happened, but when we got there they said the reservation was for 1 person, not two. I didn't know what to say. We thought we had a place to stay & this was upsetting. So, I just said "Well, do you not have room for two of us? Because if not we need to go find another place to stay." Thing is, rather than being courteous, the man at the front desk, Massimo, seemed IRATE that we were inconveniencing him with two of us. He begrudgingly said he did have room, so we went on our way up to it. The room was fine. But it had 3 beds. I knew something was up since there were only two of us (we can only sleep in one bed at a time, we obviously didn't need the third). Sure enough, when we went to check out he tried charging us twice what we had been expecting. I said it was ridiculous. He kept saying, "You book room for ONE! I cannot charge you for one!" I said that I never expected him to, but that what he was charging was FAR more than what a double should cost. Especially since when we checked in we said we would be fine with two twins or one king. Finally, he screamed for us to "SHATTAAPPPPAAAA!" and kept going on about how when people like me make mistakes the hotel always suffers. I told him I wasn't trying to rip anyone off, and he turned and snipped, "I am trying to WORK. DO YOU NOT WANT ME TO WORK? STOPPA TALKING." At this point, a crowd of older people had gathered in the lobby and was frozen with fear around us. I started to get REALLY angry because his attitude was NASTY, but my friend calmed me down. She asked who the owner was. He said "Massimo." Then we asked where Massimo was & he said "I AM MASSIMO." We looked at eachother and rolled our eyes. In the end, Massimo ended up acting like a pathetic, angry martyr and giving us the single room rate, which we didn't even ask for or ever expect. So it was good we spent less than we were expecting, but we ended up spending the extra money on wine to calm ourselves down. We were REALLY offended & upset (not how you want to spend your vacation time). I'd rather have just paid more and been treated with kindness and respect by the staff. Moral of the story... do not stay there. If you have to, tell Massimo we said hello. Preferably with the back of your hand held up in the air. Seriously, I've never felt so offended by a hotel's staff... and i"ve been to 23 countries in my life. I stay at hotels all the time. This guy Massimo is an angry, angry, bitter man. Whether he owns the hotel or not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Awaywego50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ateneo for three night in early March, the rooms were excellent with wonderful views over the canal. The Hotel staff could not have been more helpful and were more than happy to give us any information we asked for. The Hotel is in a super location only a few steets from St Marks Square and not much further to the Rialto Bridge. We would definatly stay at this hotel again should we get the chance to return to this very special city.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: gpd132
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in Venice at the last minute. We checked with Hotel Reservations (yellow sign with black letters) at the Rome Termini train station before leaving and got this hotel for 90 euro. Really strange because it was a friday night and it was carnival week. The room was very small but from what I am told that is Venician style. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was small and water in shower had low pressure and hot one second, cold the next. The staff was very friendly. The hotel was 3 minutes walk from St. Mark Square (Piazza San Marco) and from Ponte di Rialto (Rialto Bridge). Beware that its really easy to get lost in Venice so get a map and prepare to ask quite frequently where you are and how to get to where you are going. But it was what I needed at the time. I think if I had to do it again I would probably stay farther out and take a water taxi in each day to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Venice- Hotel Ateneo is the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to marry in Venice and you want to be central - Hotel Ateneo is the best. ItÂ´s a little nice hotel, a few minutes away from Rialto Bridge and Sankt Markus Square. The Hotel is also near the Teater La Fenice. The Hotel was clean, the rooms authentically and simply furnished with a breath Venice nostalgia. A good hairdresser for a wedding hairstyle is directly beside the hotel. Massimo, the hotel director, is a very friendly person, he helped us by planning our wedding. He managed the termin with the hairdresser and get us a very good adress of a photographer for our wedding (ask for Daniele Nalesso â€“ He is the best!!!). Massimo and his team are really very friendly and helpfully. When we come back to Venice one day, we will stay in Hotel Ateneo again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spooky and dark”
Reviews.Author: Suzzles20
Reviews.Content: Handy location and some staff quite nice. My friend and i had alot of trouble sleeping, particularly because it is right near the Piano Bar and noisy people going home tend to reverberate off all of the surrounding concrete. Plus the church bells chime once an hour through the night which lasts 2mins or so each time, again waking the dead. Im not a grump and we had barely slept for a week or so beforehand and are not light sleepers - might as well be sleeping outside.

Reviews.Title: “romantic, gracious, opulent ateneo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - fantastic spot near Piazza san marco and venice opera house. Lovely courtyard and rooms absoultely spotless and beautifully decorated in true venetian style even down to the Murano chandeliers. Added bonus was a great water taxi ride to Murano - felt like you were a movie star! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Chilled Atmosphere at Ateneo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at Albergo (Hotel) Ateneo. They let us into the room early (as we'd arrived on an overnight train) and with no fuss at all. They also let us take breakfast. The staff were always helpful and happy to oblige, without being obtrusive or unnecessary. They made us coffee at any time and let us use their Internet connection. The room was small, but the bathroom was excellent and the bed was good. And when you see the price and the location, you won't believe it! There was a fridge and a safe in the room - details which you will no doubt appreciate greatly. Breakfast up til ten a.m. which is handy if you're on honeymoon! And you can eat your fill...and then go back to bed with no fuss! There's also a lovely marble-floored corridor where you can sit and enjoy the splendid ambience, or look out the window onto a traditional canal with gondolas sailing by. Very lovely it was. And we booked it all easily on the Internet and with one simple phone call to confirm. Goodbye!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ateneo
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Minelli San Marco 3673, 30124 Venice, Italy
